entry.title: Digital Universe
entry.summary:
"In the digital universe, there are two kinds of bits: bits that represent structures (differences in space) and bits that represent sequence (differences in time). Digital computers - as formalized by Alan Turing, and developed by John von Neumann - are devices that translate between these two species of bits according to definite rules."

—George Dyson: Turing's Cathedral

System Message: ERROR/3 (/Users/jjangsangy/Projects/sanghan/content/digital_universe.rst, line 21)

Content block expected for the "code-block" directive; none found.

.. code-block:: python
def translator(source, target, phrase):

''' Returns the url encoded string that will be pushed to the translation server for parsing.

param source:Language code for translation source
type source:str
param target:Language code that source will be translate into
type target:str
param phrase:Text body string that will be url encoded and translated
type phrase:str
returns:url
rtype:str

List of acceptable language codes for source and target languages can be found as a JSON file in the etc directory.

Some source languages are limited in scope of the possible target languages that are available.

>>> import translate
>>> translator('en', 'zh-TW', 'Hello World!')
    '你好世界！'

''' base = 'http://translate.google.com/translate_a/t' params = urlencode({

System Message: ERROR/3 (/Users/jjangsangy/Projects/sanghan/content/digital_universe.rst, line 52)

Unexpected indentation.
'client': 'webapp', 'ie': 'utf-8', 'oe': 'utf-8', 'sl': source, 'tl': target, 'q': phrase

System Message: WARNING/2 (/Users/jjangsangy/Projects/sanghan/content/digital_universe.rst, line 58)

Block quote ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.

}) url = '?'.join([base, params]) return url
